author: Allison Prang
title: Humana-Led Group to Buy Hospice Operator in $1.4 Billion Deal
text:
Three different firms, including health insurer Humana Inc., are buying hospice operator Curo Health Services for about $1.4 billion as the consortium looks to expand its footprint in the home health-care business.
Humana, TPG Capital and Welsh, Carson, Anderson & Stowe said Monday they reached a deal to buy privately held Curo and ultimately plan to combine it with Kindred at Home Divisionâ€™s hospice business. The same three firms announced plans to purchaseKindred Healthcare Inc., the parent firm of Kindred at Home, in... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
